articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Palestinian Islamist group Hamas said on Wednesday it would not take part in a new round of Gaza ceasefire talks slated for Thursday in Qatar, dimming hopes for a negotiated truce that Iranian sources say could hold back an Iranian attack on Israel.
articles.title: Hamas to stay out of Gaza truce talks, Iran considers Israel attack

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida said he will step down in September, ending a three-year term marred by political scandals and paving the way for a new premier to address the impact of rising prices.
articles.title: Japan PM Kishida to step down in September

articles.author: Chayut Setboonsarng, Panarat Thepgumpanat
articles.description: Thailand's Constitutional Court will on Wednesday decide the fate of Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin, in a ruling that could see him dismissed after less than a year in office and plunge the country into deeper political uncertainty.
articles.title: Judgment day for Thai PM Srettha as court rules on dismissal case

articles.author: Richard Cowan
articles.description: Firebrand U.S. Representative Ilhan Omar clinched the Democratic Party nomination for a fourth term on Tuesday, in a victory for progressives after losses in party primaries by two fellow members of the group nicknamed "The Squad."
articles.title: Ilhan Omar wins Democratic nomination, boosts US House liberals

articles.author: Gerry Doyle
articles.description: The U.S. Navy's deployment of new extremely long-range air-to-air missiles in the Indo-Pacific could erase China's advantage in aerial reach, experts say, part of an intensifying focus on projecting power amid high tensions in the region.
articles.title: U.S. Navy's newest air-to-air missile could tilt balance in South China Sea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine kept pounding the Russian border region of Kursk with missiles and drones on Wednesday, as Kyiv said it had made further territorial gains in an incursion that U.S. President Joe Biden called a "real dilemma" for the Kremlin's leader.
articles.title: Ukraine keeps pounding Kursk in incursion Biden calls 'real dilemma' for Putin

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military said it had carried out an airstrike on Palestinian militants in the occupied West Bank on Wednesday while Hamas said its fighters were engaged in fierce clashes with Israeli forces in the territory's Tubas city.
articles.title: Israeli forces, Palestinian militants clash in occupied West Bank

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: A New York judge declined for a third time to step aside from the case in which Donald Trump was convicted of charges involving hush money paid to a porn star, dismissing the former U.S. president's claim of conflict of interest related to political consultancy work by the judge's daughter.
articles.title: Trump loses third bid for judge to step aside in hush money case

articles.author: Tim Kelly, Rocky Swift
articles.description: Outgoing Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida on Wednesday urged his colleagues to embrace change and seek out a candidate that will transform an unpopular incumbent party with bleak electoral prospects.
articles.title: Outgoing Japanese leader urges ruling party to embrace change

articles.author: Paul Sandle, Millie Mccaughan
articles.description: Taylor Swift will take to the stage in London on Thursday, resuming the world's biggest ever concert tour amid tightened security after a foiled Islamic State-inspired attack forced the cancellation of her Vienna dates last week.
articles.title: Taylor Swift set for emotional London return after terror threat
